title: 4 Course Peruvian Cooking Class
description: Lima has been dubbed one of the world’s best cities for food and this small-group cooking experience in Miraflores guides you through some of Peru’s best dishes. Follow along with your instructor and create a delicious meal with fresh, Peruvian dishes. Learn background information on your creations and then tuck into a 4-course meal with your group and instructor.
all_descriptions: Lima has been dubbed one of the world’s best cities for food and this small-group cooking experience in Miraflores guides you through some of Peru’s best dishes. Follow along with your instructor and create a delicious meal with fresh, Peruvian dishes. Learn background information on your creations and then tuck into a 4-course meal with your group and instructor.

Situated in the center of Lima's Miraflores District, SkyKitchen offers you a unique three hour experience. We show you how to cook your own Peruvian food. Enjoy your self-prepared dishes while having a conversation with your fellow participants and us. 

The cooking class starts at 11 am, where we will prepare 4 traditional Peruvian dishes, we will be done at about 2:15 pm. 

During the class you will get to prepare the dishes under the instructions of our chef, and also eat them once they are ready. 

The meeting point is in our location, in a beautiful terrace, at Enrique Palacios 470, app. 701. 

The class includes water, fruit drink and one Pisco Sour.

SkyKitchen Peruvian Cooking Classes, Ca. Enrique Palacios 470, Miraflores 15074, PeruAddress: Enrique Palacios 470, Dpto 701, Miraflores, Lima, Peru
Ring at the front door of the building.
Ask for SkyKitchen and wait for the doorman to open the door.
In the elevator go to floor 7, ring at 701
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.
provider:

Freedom01576175256
10 contributions

Absolute recommendation

Jun 2025 • Solo
What a great afternoon! The course was really fun and I was really surprised how easy it was to prepare such delicious things. I don't think I've ever cooked food so nicely, I was really proud. Because a lot was prepared for us, we had time to prepare four things. The instructors were really cool and told us a lot of interesting things about the dishes and the ingredients. Also, the location is super nice. If I am back in Peru, I would definitely come back and join one of the other menus that are available to choose from.

arctic f
27 contributions

You can’t go higher than Skykitchen!

Jun 2025 • Friends
A fantastic cooking class-

We prepared Pisco Sour and dishes that we then liked even more than those of various local restaurants tried in the previous days.
The lesson takes place in a modern kitchen, nice, and everything ready to cook and tidied up immediately with discretion- )
A really fun and interesting evening, we learned much more than 4 classic Peruvian dishes!
I recommend it for groups of friends/colleagues (like us) or even families. If I return to Lima I would do another even more complete, including shopping at the market and use of local fruit:)
A big thank you to our hosts/masters!
We will not forget your Skykitchen!

Holly S
Villa Rica, GA51 contributions

One of the highlights of our visit to Lima.

Mar 2025 • Couples
We were visiting family in Lima, last week. My hubby and I were looking for something fun to do on our own. I found Sky Kitchen on TripAdvisor and booked it. It turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip! Yurac and Maritza (sp?) were great. We had so much fun learning about the history of Peru and their cuisine. We also liked that the class size was small so it was more personable. This class would be good for couples or families with older children. The food was so delicious! I hope that I can recreate the meals, we made, when I try to make them at home!
Written March 19, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Hans
Bodegraven, The Netherlands1 contribution

A must for foodies.

Jan 2025 • Couples
A very nice and educational experience. Lots of explanations about products and useful tips & tricks. We foodies have learned a lot from it and are even more motivated to make the tasty dishes from Peruvian cuisine at home. And of course the pisco sour. Make sure to bring at least a bottle of Pisco when you fly home! Because we had already made a market tour during a previous stay in Lima, we did not do that this year. For a complete picture of Peruvian cuisine, such a tour is also highly recommended. We have experienced the flexibility and conviviality as very enjoyable. Thank you!

Seattle, WA4 contributions

Fabulous afternoon in a beautiful setting

This is a wonderful activity as a solo traveler to meet a variety of people visiting Lima. The recipes are wonderful and the techniques were very helpful. I’ve returned to the US and have enjoyed using what I learned to cook for friends.

Marlène N
1 contribution

Wonderful cooking class in Lima

Dec 2024 • Family
My 12-year old son and I enjoyed this wonderful cooking experience in Lima on Dec 31. I had some Peruvian cuisine experience, but I learned so much about the ingredients and techniques that make it so unique. The kitchen and dining area offer an amazing view of the whole city and everything was really well organized for us to have the best time, enjoy the food we cooked and ask questions to our chef, Yurac. He was very patient and incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. I highly recommend this fun cooking and dining activity during your stay in Lima.
Written January 17, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Facundo S
General San Martin1 contribution

Must-see experience!

Jan 2025 • Family
Yurac, Christian and Maritza allowed me and my son to live an unforgettable experience. Seeing the step by step of the incredible dishes of Peruvian cuisine, was a real pleasure. And let alone that we then enjoyed what was produced! The atmosphere is warm, relaxed and friendly. It is an experience that I will not fail to recommend.

Joe T
13 contributions

If you enjoy cooking or eating, do this

This is a very fun and interesting class. Whether you're a novice or experienced in the kitchen, you will learn some things. You get the recipes and can try them at home. Just try to eat all you make. It will be a challenge. Highly recommend.
Written December 20, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Renate W
Eggenfelden, Germany10 contributions

How a Peru holiday should begin

Had a superb introduction to Peruvian cuisine with Christian. In excellent German and English we received a lot of tips and a comprehensive insight into the extraordinary cuisine of the country. After the preparation of the pisco sour followed Causa, Ceviche, Lumo saltado and Picarones. I can't imagine a better start to a Peru holiday.
A very special thank you also for sending all recipes in German.
